bug.author: wkentaro
bug.summary: PIL installed via pip cannot be imported on Travis osx
bug.description: <denchmark-code>Traceback (most recent call last): File "labelme/app.py", line 15, in <module> from labelme import __appname__ File "/Users/travis/miniconda/envs/test/lib/python3.6/site-packages/PyInstaller/loader/pyimod03_importers.py", line 631, in exec_module exec(bytecode, module.__dict__) File "labelme/__init__.py", line 14, in <module> from labelme import testing File "/Users/travis/miniconda/envs/test/lib/python3.6/site-packages/PyInstaller/loader/pyimod03_importers.py", line 631, in exec_module exec(bytecode, module.__dict__) File "labelme/testing.py", line 4, in <module> import labelme.utils File "/Users/travis/miniconda/envs/test/lib/python3.6/site-packages/PyInstaller/loader/pyimod03_importers.py", line 631, in exec_module exec(bytecode, module.__dict__) File "labelme/utils.py", line 6, in <module> import PIL.Image File "/Users/travis/miniconda/envs/test/lib/python3.6/site-packages/PyInstaller/loader/pyimod03_importers.py", line 631, in exec_module exec(bytecode, module.__dict__) File "site-packages/PIL/Image.py", line 64, in <module> File "/Users/travis/miniconda/envs/test/lib/python3.6/site-packages/PyInstaller/loader/pyimod03_importers.py", line 714, in load_module module = loader.load_module(fullname) ImportError: dlopen(/var/folders/bb/n7t3rs157850byt_jfdcq9k80000gn/T/_MEIZHGinu/PIL._imaging.so, 2): Library not loaded: @loader_path/libjpeg.9.dylib Referenced from: /var/folders/bb/n7t3rs157850byt_jfdcq9k80000gn/T/_MEIZHGinu/PIL._imaging.so Reason: Incompatible library version: PIL._imaging.so requires version 13.0.0 or later, but libjpeg.9.dylib provides version 12.0.0 [3356] Failed to execute script app </denchmark-code>

comments.comment: PIL must be installed via conda for pyinstaller.
